alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:28PM EDT until May 08 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek At Harper Tavern affecting Schuylkill and Lebanon Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Aughwick Creek At Shirleysburg affecting Huntingdon County. For the Aughwick Creek...including Shirleysburg...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Swatara Creek...including Harper Tavern...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Aughwick Creek At Shirleysburg. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg exceeds its banks. Several homes are affected. At 12.0 feet, Flood waters from Aughwick Creek cover portions of Gilbo Road, Aughwick Mills Road and Keystone Road in Shirley Township. At 13.2 feet, Route 522 closes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Saturday was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 6.7 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning.
